body.p:
Owenton May 5 -- 1862
To his Excellency Gov Magoffin --

The undersigned your petitioner states that he has been prosecuted in the Owen circuit court as he believes out of malice for a breach of the peace, and to save expense & further trouble in in his procuring witnesses to defend; the Commonwealth not being ready to try -- he has confessed judgment ^at the present term of the court^ relying upon the mercy of the Governor to remit the Judgment rendered (one hundred dollars) except the costs; which he asks may be remitted -- & further he will ever pray --

The undersigned respectfully state that they believe the case presented above for the exercise of executive clemency, is worthy the consideration of his excellency the Governor and believe as an act of Justice the judgment should be remitted except the costs, --

E T Nuttall
N H Sandford
J M Morduff
Ben F Sidebottom Sheriff Owen
Tho. A
C. P. Green
B Major
E. F. Burns
J. N. Witt
J S Hill
William Scruggs
